docs.snippet: THE WEATHER ON THE COAST. Arrivals at this port yesterday report the late northeast gale along the ceast as very heavy. The steamship Quaker City, from Havana on the 15th, reports that it blew almost a hurricane from the time she left Havana, varying...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE WEATHER ON THE COAST. Arrivals at this port yesterday report the late northeast gale along the ceast as very heavy. The steamship Quaker City, from Havana on the 15th, reports that it blew almost a hurricane from the time she left Havana, varying from East to E.N.E. The steamer Marion, from Charleston, experienced a continuous gale, and had portions of her wheel-house and bulwarks carried away by the sea.
